summary: An email from American Express Special Investigations Manager Kristina Hendrickson to an unspecified recipient, referencing a prior conversation about Jeffrey Epstein's American Express account activity and notifying the recipient that a Suspicious Activity Report (SAR) has been filed. The email offers to provide a copy of the SAR and supporting documentation.

persons.name: Kristina Hendrickson
persons.role: Manager - Special Investigations, Financial Intelligence Unit at American Express
persons.context: The sender of the email, who is reaching out regarding a Suspicious Activity Report (SAR) filed on Jeffrey Epstein's American Express accounts and offering to share the report and documentation.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.role: Subject of the Suspicious Activity Report
persons.context: Referred to as 'Mr. Epstein', his American Express account activity is the subject of the SAR mentioned in the email.

connections.description: Hendrickson, as a manager in American Express's Special Investigations unit, is investigating and reporting on Epstein's financial account activity.

events.title: American Express SAR Filing Notification
events.description: Kristina Hendrickson emails an unspecified recipient to notify them that American Express has filed a Suspicious Activity Report (SAR) regarding Jeffrey Epstein's account activity and offers to provide the report and documentation.

events.title: Prior Conversation about Epstein's Accounts
events.description: The email references a conversation that occurred the previous year (2019) between Hendrickson and the recipient regarding Epstein's American Express account activity.

locations: 18850 N. 56th Street, Phoenix, AZ 85058 (American Express Financial Intelligence Unit office)
keyFacts: American Express filed a Suspicious Activity Report (SAR) regarding Jeffrey Epstein's American Express accounts.
The SAR filing occurred by or before January 24, 2020, as indicated by the email notification.
American Express's Special Investigations unit had been examining Epstein's account activity since at least 2019.
The email is an offer from American Express to share the SAR and supporting documentation with an unspecified recipient, likely a law enforcement or regulatory agency.
